revised_title: Thermal Stability in Rotating Spherical Fluid Shells with Non-Uniform Heating
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
tldr: The study investigates the convective stability of a rotating spherical fluid shell with non-uniform heating. The analysis focuses on the effects of heat escaping from the interior and the influence of an initial shear flow on the fluid's stability. Numerical results are presented for two fluid shell thicknesses, demonstrating the impact of the initial flow on the system's behavior.
